SUGAMMADEX

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • National funding/access decisions
  • Important safety information
  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Routine reversal of neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium or vecuronium,

By intravenous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 2–4 mg/kg, then 4 mg/kg if required, administered if recurrence of neuromuscular blockade occurs; consult product literature for further details.

Immediate reversal of neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium,

By intravenous injection

  • For adults
    16 mg/kg (consult product literature).

Advice when patient is pregnant

Use with caution—no information available.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Avoid if eGFR less than 30 mL/ minute/1.73 m2.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Bradycardia, bronchospasm, cardiac arrest, hypersensitivity reactions,

National funding/access decisions

Important safety information

Should only be administered by, or under the direct supervision of, personnel experienced in its use.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Cardiovascular disease (recovery may be delayed)
  • elderly (recovery may be delayed)
  • pre-existing coagulation disorders
  • recurrence of neuromuscular blockade— monitor respiratory function until fully recovered
  • use of anticoagulants (unrelated to surgery)
  • wait 24 hours before re-administering rocuronium
  • wait 24 hours before re-administering vecuronium

Prepared medicinal forms of SUGAMMADEX

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for injection
